parameters.name: Brandon
parameters.teaser: 4 month old boy who presents with 2 days of abdominal pain. He is fussy and drowsy, with a palpable left lower quadrant mass
parameters.clinical_descrip: Previously healthy 4 m/o boy with abdominal pain for 2 days.  An outside ED discharged him yesterday with “viral gastroenteritis”, and the parents were told it would resolve on its own.  Now he is fussy and drowsy, with a soft, mildly distended abdomen and a large, firm, palpable, tender mass in the LUQ.  Bilious emesis was observed in ER.  Temperature 101.5, Pulse 180. The patient was crying but there were no tears and his mucous membranes were dry.  IV fluids have been administered, and he is no longer hypotensive.  Rectal examination is positive for bright red blood.  WBC 22.1K HCT 45.
